questions.text: Most common cause of acute epididymitis in males: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Chlamydia trachomatis is the most common organism causing acute epididymoorchitis If the question specifically says what is the most common cause of epididymoorchitis in young males the answer will be chlamydia trachomatis But if the question says what will be the most common cause of acute epididymoorchitis in elderly person or age > 40 years then the answer will be E.Coli. Proteus and N. Gonoorrhea can rarely cause epididymoorchitis

choices.text: Elevation of testis increases pain of epididymitis
Elevation of testis reduces pain of epididymitis
Depression of testis increases pain of epididymitis
Depression of testis reduces pain of epididymitis

questions.text: Positive Prehn's sign is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Phren Sign : It is used to differentiate between acute epididymoorchitis and testicular torsion, both the above stated conditions are the DD’s of painful scrotal swelling and need to be differentiated from each other to determine the proper management. If on elevation of testis pain reduces then it is acute epididymoorchitis and if on elevation of testis pain increases then the condition is likely to be testicular torsion.

questions.text: T.B. testis first affects: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Tuberculosis of urogenital system is always secondary and affects kidney and prostate first as the bacteria spreads to these organs via hematogenous route. Rest of the organs of urogenital system are affected either by an ascent or descent of the infection. So whenever testis are involved the Tuberculosis first involves epididymis via retrograde pathway and then only it can affect the testicular tissue. This is how tuberculosis affects the urogenital system . So out of the above mentioned 4 options first structure to be involved is Epididymis.

choices.text: Does not mimic with torsion of testes

questions.text: True about acute epididymitis is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Acute epididymoorchitis is associated with urinary tract infection. And many times patients will actually come with complaints of increased frequency of micturition and and burning micturition and they can have WBCs in their urine. Option B is wrong because these patients actually come with painful scrotal swelling, pain can be severe and is one of the DD’s of Testicular torsion. Option C is also false as in epididymoorchitis there occurs a swelling in the scrotum and size of scrotum increases. Option D is also false as epidymoorchitis is actually a primary DD of testicular torsion and can be distinguished by Prehn test.

choices.text: Elevation of testis in torsion relieves pain
Elevation of testis in epididymoorchitis relieves pain
Tendemess is characteristic of torsion of testis

questions.text: ln differential diagnosis of epididymo-orchitis and torsion it is important that: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A is false. In the evaluation of a patient with painful scrotum swelling we have 2 differential diagnosis: Acute epididymo orchitis and Testicular torsion and it is very important to differentiate between them to decide the further management of the patient. We have Phren test which we use to differentiate the two conditions. In this we basically elevate the testis and on elevation of testis in epididymo-orchitis what we find is the pain is reduced while in testicular torsion on elevation of testis the pain is increased. This is how we can differentiate between the two conditions. Option C is right as a patient of testicular torsion always comes with painful testicular swelling. Option D is also right as I have already told you that epididymo orchitis is an infective and inflammatory condition so what we get is signs of inflammation like raised temperature, tenderness and erythematous skin and raised WBCs.

choices.text: Presents with sudden pain in testis
Doppler U/S shows decreased blood flow to the testis
Simultaneous orchiopexy of the other side should also be done

questions.text: True about torsion of testis is all except (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is false testicular torsion is not associated with pyuria, pyuria is a feature of epididymoorchitis Option A is true, testicular torsion presents as a painful scrotal mass Option c is true, USG Doppler is the investigation of choice for testicular torsion and it shows decreased blood flow on Doppler study Option d is also true as there is a congenital predispositing factors for development of testicular torsion so we need to carry out bilateral orchidopexy as there is a high chance that similar congenital predisposition would be present in opposite testis as well.

choices.text: The right testis is likely to ride high compartment
If torsion confirmed, treat with antibiotics and analgesic and perform corrective surgery immediately
If torsion confirmed, treat with antibiotics and analgesic and perform corrective surgery after 14 days

questions.text: A 3O-years old male patient presents with sudden onset swelling and pain over the right hemiscrotum. On examination the scrotum is reddened and tender. Which of the following statement about the affecting condition is not true? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The case scenario describes a condition of acute painful swelling of the scrotum with signs of redness and inflammation which developed suddenly in a 30 year old man so the probable diagnosis in this case is a testicular tortsion of right side. Option B is correct as right testis has undergone torsion it tends to lie at a higher level as compared to left testis. Please note that testicular torsion is a surgical emergency and needs to be treated immediately, golden period for testicular torsion is 4-6 hours it means that if testicular torsion is treated within this time frame there is a chance that testis can be preserved but if surgical intervention for testicular torsion is delayed by more than 6 hours we have to subject the patient for orchidectomy as testis become non viable.

questions.text: All of the following abnormalities are predisposing causes for torsion of the testis except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) low investment of tunica vaginalis does not predispose the patient to testicular torsion infact high investment of tunica vaginalis predisposes a person for testicular torsion and this is known as bell clapper’s deformity. Option A is true as inversion of testis predisposes the patient to testicular torsion infact inversion of testis is the most common predisposing factor for testicular torsion. Option C is true as young adults are most commonly affected with testicular torsion. Option D is also correct as separation of epididymis from testis forms a mesentery like attachment between two structures and they can twist along this axis and lead to testicular torsion .

choices.text: Common in adolescents and young adults
Inversion of testis is the most common predisposing cause
Elevation of testis reduces the pain
If diagnosis is doubtful, prompt exploration is the rule

questions.text: All are true regarding torsion of the testis, except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Phren Sign : It is used to differentiate between acute epididymoorchitis and testicular torsion, both the above stated conditions are the DD’s of painful scrotal swelling and need to be differentiated from each other to determine the proper management. If on elevation of testis pain reduces then it is acute epididymoorchitis and if on elevation of testis pain increases then the condition is likely to be testicular torsion.

choices.text: Can present as a later sign of renal cell carcinoma
Has bag of worm like feeling

questions.text: Not true about varicocele is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) varicocele is more common on Left side as left testicular vein drains directly into left renal vein at right angle and is subjected to a constant high pressure but right testicular vein drains into IVC. So as left tesiticular vein is subjected to a constant high pressure there is more chance of development of varicocele on left side. Option B is correct as Varicocele can present as a late sign of RCC. RCC tends to grow along the veins as a tumor thrombus. So if left sided RCC grows into left renal vein it can obstruct the opening of left sided testicular vein and lead to formation of left sided irreducible varicocele. Option C is correct as in varicocele we have dilated tortuous pampiniform plexus of veins and when they on palpation gives a bag of worm like feel. Option D is also correct, infact varicocele is the most common cause of infertility in males. What happens is that due to varicocele there is pooling of blood and temperature of the testis is bit raised than usual so it hampers with the process of spermatogenesis and can lead to infertility.

choices.text: Left testicular vein drains into IVC which has high Pressure
Left testicular vein drains into left renal vein which has high pressure
Compression of testicular vein by rectum

questions.text: Varicocele is common on left testis because: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Varicocele is more common on left side as compared to right side and one of the main reasons for this that left testicular vein drains into left renal vein at right angle and is subjected to a constant high pressure.

choices.text: More common on the right side
May be the first feature of a renal tumour
Feels like a bag of worms

questions.text: Which is not true regarding varicocele? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ref: Love and Bailey page 1501 Varicocele is more common on left side as compared to right side and one of the main reasons for this that left testicular vein drains into left renal vein at right angle and is subjected to a constant high pressure. Option A is true as varicocele is basically dilated and tortuous testicular veins. Option C is correct as Varicocele can presenting feature of RCC. RCC tends to grow along the veins as a tumor thrombus. So if left sided RCC grows into left renal vein it can obstruct the opening of left sided testicular vein and lead to formation of left sided irreducible varicocele. Option D is correct as in varicocele we have dilated tortuous pampiniform plexus of veins and when they on palpation gives a bag of worm like feel.

questions.text: A 58-years old male presenting with acute onset of varicocele on left side most probable cause: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Varicocele can be a presenting feature of RCC. RCC tends to grow along the veins as a tumor thrombus. So if left sided RCC grows into left renal vein it can obstruct the opening of left sided testicular vein which opens directly into left renal vein and this can lead to formation of left sided irreducible varicocele. Option A is false as testicular tumors never present as varicocele as one of their presenting features, testicular tumors most commonly present as a painless testicular mass or a an abdominal mass due to enlargement of retroperitoneal lymph nodes . Option B is also false as epididymitis can not present as a varicocele, rather epididymitis presents as a painful testicular swelling and is one of the DD’s of testicular torsion . Option C is also false as inguinal lymph nodes do not present as a varicocele rather they present as a painless inguinal swelling .

questions.text: Varicocele of pampiniform plexus of veins following characteristics except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Varicocele is more common on left side (in 90% cases) as compared to right side and one of the main reasons for this that left testicular vein drains into left renal vein at right angle and is subjected to a constant high pressure Option A is true as varicocele basically consists of dilated and tortuous testicular vessels, so as they contain blood within them they are negatively transilluminant. Option B is also correct as varicocele are distended testicular vessels filled with blood they are communicating with left renal vein so if a patient is asked to lie down and elevate the legs these veins tend to collapse. And this is the reason why they also have a cough impulse . Please note that If varicocele is caused because of underlying RCC or if they are thrombosed they won’t be reducible, in all the other cases varicocele is reducible and have a cough impulse positive.

questions.text: After varicocele surgery venous drainage occurs by:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) after vaicocelectomy the venous drainage is mainly maintained by cremasteric veins. Veins draining the testis and epididymis form pampiniform plexus of veins which join each other to form a testicular vein near the deep ingunal ring. Now during a varicocelectomy procedure these veins are ligated near the deep inguinal ring. Cremasteric veins are the other set of veins which for the collaterals and they drain into inferior epigastric vein. So after the testicular vein is ligated near the deep inguinal ring, venous drainage is mainly carried out by cremasterc veins.

questions.text: A young adolescent male came with painless swelling in scrotum since 2-3 months. on palpation, it feels like a bag of worms. What is the possible diagnosis? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) In varicocele we have dilated tortuous pampiniform plexus of veins and veins draining the testis, when they on palpation gives a bag of worm like feel.

questions.text: Chinese lantern on transillumination seen in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) There is crystal clear fluid in Epididymal cyst which gives Chinese lantern pattern on brilliantly transilluminant.

questions.text: Fournier’s gangrene occurs in the: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Fournier’s gangrene is a synergistic gangrene which occurs in scrotum skin. When fournier’s gangrene spreads to the anterior abdominal wall it is called as meleney’s gangrene.

questions.text: Testicular cancer is common in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) undescended testis is one which has been arrested in its normal course of descent. An undescended testis has an increased risk of testicular carcinoma by 5 to 10 times. Seminomas are the most common tumors associated with undescended testis. Option A is not correct as an ectopic testis is one which has deviated from its path of normal descent and has come to lie at an ectopic location. These testis are not at increased risk of testicular cancer. Atrophic testis is a one which has lost its viability due to loss of blood supply, these testis are also not at increased risk of testicular carcinoma.

choices.text: High inguinal exploration should be done

questions.text: A patient presented with a painless swelling in this right testis. AII are true statements except: (AIIMS May 2015)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) It is a general dictum is that a painless testicular swelling in a male is a testicular carcinoma until proven otherwise. So when a person comes to you with a painless testicular mass never perform a trans scrotal biopsy as there is a risk of tumour implantation along the track of the biopsy and overlying skin, thus making an operable tumour as inoperable. What you do is a high inguinal orchidectomy so that you get a tissue diagnosis and you have to ligate the cord at the deep inguinal ring so that there is a minimal chance of systemic spread of tumour. You can also subject the patient to USG of inguinoscrotal region so that it can give you an idea about the nature of the tumour but for confirmation you need a tissue biopsy which you get only after doing a high inguinal orchidectomy.

questions.text: Germ cell tumors of testis are: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) seminoma is a primary germ cell tumour of testis . Leydig cell tumour and gynandroblastoma are the primary but non germ cell tumours of testis. Lymphoma is a secondary tumour of the testis .

questions.text: A testicular tumor in a man aged 60 years is most likely to be: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Testicular lymphoma is the most common testicular tumour occurring in a person who is above 50-60 year old. It is a secondary tumour and has a tendency to occur bilaterally. Option A, B and C are germ cell tumour , sertoli cell tumour and teratocarcinoma, they are more common in 20 -40 years of age.

questions.text: Most common Testicular tumor in prepubertal life? (AIIMS May 15)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Most common testicular tumour in prepubertal life is teratoma.

questions.text: The lymph nodes first involved in cancer of the skin of the scrotum are: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) most common lymph nodes involved in a patient suffering from testicular carcinoma are para aortic, but the most common lymph nodes involved in a patient of testicular carcinoma with skin involvement is superficial inguinal lymph nodes. External iliac lymph nodes are not involved in testicular carcinoma . Lymph nodes of cloquet are also known as lymph nodes of rosenmuller. These are component of deep inguinal lymph nodes and are present in or adjacent the femoral canal, they are not involved in testicular carcinoma.

questions.text: Most radiosensitive testicular tumour is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most radiosensitive testicular tumour is seminoma. In lower grades of seminoma, radiotherapy is the only treatment which is necessary.

questions.text: Most common testicular tumour in 4th decade
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) most common testicular tumour in 3rd and 4th decade of life is seminoma. Option A that is teratoma is the most common testicular tumour in prepubertal age group that is between 11- 14 years of age. Most common testicular tumour in children between 1-3 years of age is yolk sac tumour

choices.text: Pure seminoma is more aggressive than non-seminoma
Seminoma can be treated by orchidectomy with radiotherapy

questions.text: which of the following is false about testicular tumor?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is wrong as seminoma have a benign course as compared to non-seminoma. So it is non seminomatous germ cell tumours which have more aggressive course . Option B is correct as seminoma responds very well to radiotherapy. Infact it has been described as a tumour which melts with radiotherapy. Option C is correct as high inguinal orchidectomy is a must to be done for any patient with testicular malignancy and after that if it comes out to be seminoma we have to subject the patient to radiotherapy. Option D is correct as seminomatous tumours spread more commonly via lymphatics and non seminomatous tumours spread more commonly via hematogenous spread.

questions.text: Which of the following is not seen in testicular carcinoma? (PGI Nov 2015)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) epididymoorchitis is not a usual way in which a testicular carcinoma can present. Testicular carcinoma typically presents as a painless testicular swelling. Option A is correct as testicular carcinoma patients sometimes present as an abdominal mass, the reason behind this that retroperitoneal paraaortic lymphnodes are the first draining lymphnodes of testicular carcinoma and if testicular carcinoma is left neglected it can present as an enlarged retroperitoneal lymphnode and present as an abdominal mass. Option C is correct as superficial inguinal lymph nodes can be enlarged in testicular carcinoma patients due to involvement of scrotal skin. Option D is also correct as sometimes secondary vaginal hydrocele is a presentation of an underlying testicular carcinoma.

choices.text: Tumors remain localized to testis for a long time
They are often associated with raised revels of serum AFP and HCG

questions.text: All of the following clinicopathologic features are seen more often in seminomas as compared to non-seminomatous germ cell tumors of the testis except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) AFP is never raised in pure seminomas. Tumor markers raised in pure seminomas are B-HCG, LDH , PLAP ,CD-117, OCT3/4 ,Podoplanin , Nanog.

questions.text: Testicular tumor with best prognosis is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) seminoma is the one which has the best prognosis . Option A that is teratoma has an intermediate prognosis and an important thing to remember about it is teratoma is not responsive to chemotherapy at all and is treated just by surgical excision. Option C is choriocarcinoma and that has a worst prognosis amongst all the testicular tumours. Please note that yolk sac tumour has better prognosis as compared to seminoma but as it is not in the option seminoma is the answer in this question.

questions.text: A testicular tumor in a man aged 60 years is most likely to be: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Testicular lymphoma is the most common testicular tumour occurring in a person who is above 50-60 year old. It is a secondary tumour and has a tendency to occur bilaterally. Option A, B and C are germ cell tumour, sertoli cell tumour and teratocarcinoma, they are more common in 20 -40 years of age.

questions.text: Shyam, a 50-years old male presents with a hard scrotal swelling. All of the following can be done except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) we never perform a testicular biopsy in patients in whom we suspect a testicular carcinoma because if we do so we end up infiltrating the tract of the biopsy with testicular tumour cells . This can spread the tumour cells to the skin and as skin gets involved the tumour cells can spread to inguinal lymph node. If this happens just because of the intervention of taking the trans scrotal biopsy we converted a tumour which was confined to the testis into a metastatic disease . So we never perform a trans scrotal procedure in any patient in whom we suspect a testicular malignancy. Option B is correct as we do perform a Chest Xray in these patients to screen for lung metastasis. Option C is correct as we have to perform an inguinal exploration with high inguinal orchidectomy to make the diagnosis of testicular tumour. Option D is correct as we have to perform a CT scan in these patients to look for any retroperitoneal spread of tumour to retroperitoneal lymph nodes.

questions.text: Which is not a tumor marker for seminoma ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Tumor markers raised in pure seminomas are B-HCG, LDH, PLAP, CD-117 , OCT3/4 , Podoplanin, Nanog.

questions.text: What % of testicular carcinoma is associated with cryptorchidism? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) About 10 % of testicular carcinomas are associated with cryptorchidism

choices.text: Are embryonal cell carcinomas in 95% of cases
Teratomas are more common than seminomas

questions.text: which of the following statements is true regarding testicular tumors ? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A is wrong seminoma is most common testicular tumour. Option B is wrong as testicular carcinomas are bilateral in 1-2 % of cases and not in 10 % of cases Option C is wrong as seminoma is more common than teratoma.

choices.text: It arises only from cryptorchid testis

questions.text: Which of the following is true about seminoma?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is the answer to this question as seminoma is one of the testicular tumours which is extremely radiosensitive. Option B is wrong as even though the most common tumour to arise in cryptorchid testis is seminoma , seminoma can occur even in a non cryptorchid testis. Option C is wrong as AFP is not raised in seminoma. Option D is wrong as seminoma is not at all chemosensitive.

questions.text: Testis tumour is associated with secondary hydrocele in:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Testicular tumours are associated with secondary hydrocele in 10 % cases .

questions.text: Carcinoma testis, the lymphatic metastasis goes to the first site seen in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Testis arise embryologically in the retroperitoneum from the genital ridge. They descend down to lie in the scrotum. It is the tendency of an organ to drain to the lymph node from the region it is arising so testicular pathologies drain in the retroperitoneal para aortic group of lymph nodes.

questions.text: Most malignant testicular tumor is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option C is the answer as choriocarcinoma is the most malignant testicular tumour and has a very rapid onset and spread and is a very aggressive tumour . Choriocarcinoma has the worst prognosis amongst all the testicular tumours. Option A that is seminoma has an indolent course and has a good prognosis . Option B that is teratoma is a locally aggressive tumour with malignant potential.

questions.text: A 2O-years old male presents with scrotal mass. The first investigation to be done is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) whenever a person comes to you with a testicular swelling, the first thing to be done is a clinical examination as the investigations are not reliable to make the definitive diagnosis of testicular pathologies and clinical examination is a very important step in determining the treatment plan for the patient. Option B that is USG should be done after clinical examination, it will suggest whether the swelling is solid or cystic and help to reinforce the clinical diagnosis . Option C that is biopsy is never performed in testicular swelling when you suspect a testicular malignancy. Option D that is AFP is done at a later stage in the management of testicular swelling.

questions.text: A 12-year old boy presents with scrotal mass. The next best thing to do in this patient is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is the answer in this question as whenever a patient comes to you with a scrotal swelling first thing to do is a clinical examination as this gives a good idea about the nature and the consistency of the swelling. Option B that is USG is done as the first investigation after the clinical examination. Option C that is biopsy is never performed in a patient of testicular swelling If you suspect a testicular malignancy as there is a risk of spread of tumour cells to the scrotal skin. Option D that is immediate surgery is performed in case of a painful scrotal swelling when we do not have availability of doppler or doppler finding is inconclusive and you suspect the patient to suffer from testicular torsion.

questions.text: High inguinal orchidectomy specimen showed tumor testis with involvement of epididymis without vascular invasion stage is: (AIIMS May 2015)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The pathological T (pT) stage for testicular tumors, as per the TNM classification system, defines the extent of local tumor invasion. In this case, the high inguinal orchidectomy specimen reveals a tumor confined to the testis and involving the epididymis, crucially, without any evidence of vascular or lymphatic invasion. This specific combination of features is the defining characteristic of a pT1 stage testicular tumor. A pT1 tumor is strictly limited to the testis and/or epididymis, and it does not demonstrate invasion into lymphovascular spaces within the testis or epididymis. It may, however, invade the tunica albuginea, the fibrous capsule surrounding the testis. The absence of vascular invasion is the key differentiator that keeps this tumor within the pT1 classification despite epididymal involvement. Incorrect Options: B. T2: A pT2 stage tumor, while still confined to the testis and epididymis, would be characterized by the presence of vascular or lymphatic invasion. Alternatively, pT2 can also be assigned if the tumor extends through the tunica albuginea and involves the tunica vaginalis. Since the case explicitly states "without vascular invasion," these criteria for pT2 are not met. C. T3: A pT3 stage tumor signifies invasion into the spermatic cord. This means the tumor has extended beyond the confines of the testis and epididymis and has entered the spermatic cord structures. The description in the question does not mention any involvement of the spermatic cord, making T3 an incorrect option. D. T4: A pT4 stage tumor indicates that the tumor has invaded the scrotum. This is the most extensive local invasion. The case description clearly limits the tumor's extent to the testis and epididymis, with no mention of scrotal involvement, thus ruling out T4.

questions.text: Stage I seminoma testis, treatment of choice is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: The treatment of metastatic testicular carcinoma is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) the chemotherapeutic regimen used for treatment of testicular carcinoma is BEP i.e. Bleomycin, Etoposide and Cisplatin.

choices.text: Left high inguinal orchidectomy plus chemotherapy

questions.text: A 27-years old man presents with a left testicular tumor with 10 cm retroperitoneal lymph node mass. The treatment of choice is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) As the age of the patient is 27 years, the tumour is most likely a seminoma. As patient has lymph node enlargement of 10 cm his stage is Stage IIc so the treatment will be high inguinal orchidectomy with chemotherapy.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the treatment of choice for a 4 cm retroperitoneal lymph node mass in a patient with non seminomatous germ cell tumor of the testis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) This is a Stage IIB disease so the treatment should be High inguinal orchidectomy with RPLND +/- Chemotherapy but as this is not in the option best answer is High inguinal orchidectomy + RPLND

questions.text: A patient comes with stage III non seminomatous testicular tumor, treatment of choice is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Stage-II testicular teratoma is treated by: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: Most common Testicular tumor in prepubertal life? (AIIMS May 15)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A that is seminoma is the most common testicular tumour in 3rd and 4th decode of life. Option B that is teratoma is the most common testicular tumour in prepubertal age group that is between 11- 14 years of age. Most common testicular tumour in children between 1-3 years of age is yolk sac tumour.

questions.text: The lymph nodes first involved in cancer of the skin of the scrotum are: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) most common lymph nodes involved in a patient suffering from testicular carcinoma are para aortic But the most common lymph nodes involved in a patient of testicular carcinoma with skin involvement is superficial inguinal lymph nodes. External iliac lymph nodes are not involved in testicular carcinoma . Lymph nodes of cloquet are also known as lymph nodes of rosenmuller. These are component of deep inguinal lymph nodes and are present in or adjacent the femoral canal, they are not involved in testicular carcinoma.

questions.text: A 40-years-old man complains of loss of sensation over the right scrotum and on the medial right thigh. Damage to which of the following nerves would result in such symptoms?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) This question allows us to review the sensory innervations of the perineum and vicinity. The ilioinguinal nerve supplies the skin of the scrotum and the medial thigh with sensory fibers.
